TITLE: Mark Cuban reveals the 14-second pitch he used to make money at his first sales job
SUMMARY: As a boy, Mark Cuban sold boxes of garbage bags door-to-door. This 14-second sales pitch he developed for his neighbors was his key to success, he says.

TITLE: Biden names pick for new IRS head as agency plans for $80 billion funding, wrestles with backlog
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden intends to nominate Danny Werfel to become the next IRS Commissioner, overseeing the plan for the agency's nearly $80 billion in funding.

TITLE: Massachusetts voters approve 'millionaire tax.' What it means for the wealthy
SUMMARY: Massachusetts voters approved a "millionaire tax" of 4% on annual income above $1 million, on top of the state's current 5% income tax. Here's what to know.

TITLE: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen's art collection smashes record with $1.6 billion auction
SUMMARY: The collection of Paul Allen, the late co-founder of Microsoft, was a treasure trove of masterpieces spanning 500 years.

TITLE: People with disabilities rate the top 10 cities that are easiest for them to travel around
SUMMARY: Those who took part rated cities based on transport links, proximity of accommodation to attractions and information availability.

TITLE: Voters approve higher minimum wage in Nebraska and Washington, D.C. Votes still being tallied in Nevada
SUMMARY: Voters in both Nebraska and the District of Columbia approved higher minimum wages, while the results in Nevada are still pending.

TITLE: Winning ticket for Powerball's record $2.04 billion jackpot sold in California — here's what will go to taxes
SUMMARY: The winner will face a 24% federal tax withholding, but whether there are state taxes due depends where the ticket holder lives.

TITLE: Kevin O'Leary: Do this for 1 hour every morning, or 'you will lose money 100% of the time'
SUMMARY: Kevin O'Leary says reading the news for one hour each morning helps with his productivity and saves him money. Here's his daily routine, and how it works.

TITLE: Rich people don’t have a ‘lottery mindset,’ says CEO—here are 3 things millionaires do differently
SUMMARY: "Wealthy people don't have a 'lottery mindset,'" says CEO and podcaster Trey Lockerbie, who has interviewed more than 100 millionaires. Here's what he learned about how the world's richest people achieve financial success.

TITLE: Billionaires emit a million times more greenhouse gases than the average person: Oxfam
SUMMARY: The investments of 125 billionaires create 393 million metric tonnes of CO2 emissions each year, Oxfam says — the equivalent output to the whole of France.

TITLE: Despite stock market losses, investors may get year-end mutual fund payouts. That can trigger a surprise tax bill.
SUMMARY: Despite stock market losses in 2022, investors may receive year-end mutual fund distributions, which can trigger a tax bill.

TITLE: The Powerball jackpot is $1.9 billion only if you take the annuity. Here's why the lump sum may be overrated
SUMMARY: Hardly anyone opts for lottery annuity payments, but with $1.9 billion at stake, there are significant advantages to spreading out this Powerball windfall.

TITLE: The $1.9 billion Powerball jackpot — the largest ever — is up for grabs. Here's the tax bill if there's a winner
SUMMARY: A big slice of winnings would go to the IRS, as well as state coffers, depending on where the ticket was purchased and where you live.

TITLE: Op-ed: Here are 3 year-end strategies for high-net-worth families to consider
SUMMARY: Here's a look at three financial-planning opportunities high-net-worth investors should not overlook amid the market drop as the year ends.

TITLE: Afraid to cruise? Not at all, say fans who are causing 'an explosion of bookings'
SUMMARY: When cruise ships dominated the news in early 2020, some said the industry would never recover. But fans are back, with some booking well into the future.

TITLE: 5 key personal finance issues this midterm election season — and what they mean for your wallet
SUMMARY: Here are some of the most pressing personal finance issues for the midterm elections — and how Tuesday's results may affect your wallet.

TITLE: Powerball's jackpot is $1.6 billion, the largest lottery prize ever. If you win, here's how much would go to taxes
SUMMARY: If there's a winner in Saturday night's Powerball drawing and they pick the upfront cash option, here's the tax bill that would come with their windfall.

TITLE: Fidelity, ForUsAll now offering 401(k) investors access to cryptocurrency
SUMMARY: Fidelity Investments and ForUsAll appear to be the first 401(k) administrators to offer workers access to cryptocurrency.

TITLE: Op-ed: High-net-worth investors can amplify their charitable impact with a 'recoverable grant'
SUMMARY: High-net-worth charitable donors can use a smart tool to support non-profit innovation this giving season. It's called a recoverable grant.

TITLE: The new European vacation? Travelers are returning for trips that are all about food and wine
SUMMARY: Travelers who have "done" Paris,  visited Tuscany and toured the U.K.'s picturesque Cotswolds region are returning to explore the food, rather than the sites.

TITLE: American billionaires spent a record $880 million on the U.S. midterm elections
SUMMARY: George Soros' $128 million in contributions made him the top political donor, followed by shipping magnate Richard Uihlein and hedge-fund founder Ken Griffin.

TITLE: At Pixar, Steve Jobs hired a director who'd 'just made a big flop'—the result was an Oscar-winning success
SUMMARY: Before Brad Bird directed "The Incredibles" and "Ratatouille," he failed at the box office. Steve Jobs, then the CEO of Pixar, saw creative promise anyway.

TITLE: Inside the $23 million mega-mansion that Yankee Candle built
SUMMARY: Juggler Meadow in Leverett, Massachusetts was built by Michael Kittredge, who made his fortune as the founder of the Yankee Candle Company.

TITLE: This 28-year-old makes $189,000 a year from 7 income streams: ‘3 side hustles you can start for $50 or less’
SUMMARY: In 2021, Josh Ellwood quit his engineering job to pursue his side hustles full-time. Now, he works just 3.5 days a week and makes $189,000 a year from seven income streams. He shares business that anyone can start today for $50 or less.

TITLE: Here's what the inverted yield curve means for your portfolio
SUMMARY: When shorter-term government bonds have higher yields than long-term, known as yield curve inversions, it’s one signal of a future recession.

TITLE: Powerball jackpot hits $1 billion — but only if you pick the less-popular prize option. If you win, here's the tax bill
SUMMARY: Regardless of whether you take the windfall as an annuity spread over three decades or as a lump sum payment upfront, taxes take a big bite out of the winnings.

TITLE: Want to book a flight but pay for it next year? Here's how it works
SUMMARY: More airlines are letting flyers book flights and pay for them over time, even after the flight has ended. Here's how "buy now, pay later" works for airfares.

TITLE: 'Your loved ones will already be in a state of trauma.' The ramifications of dying without a will
SUMMARY: Two-thirds of U.S. adults have no will, and their dying intestate has serious implications for grieving family members and other potential heirs.

TITLE: 'Millionaire tax' plans are on the ballot in California and Massachusetts. Here's what that means for taxpayers
SUMMARY: Voters in California and Massachusetts will decide whether to enact a "millionaire tax" on top earners in November. Here's what that means for taxpayers.

TITLE: Demand for Series I bonds crashes TreasuryDirect ahead of key deadline to secure 9.62% rate
SUMMARY: A record 9.62% rate on the Treasury bonds expires after Oct. 28. High volume has made the I bond website "one of the most visited" in the federal government.
